alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 1:48PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Laramie County through 215 PM MDT... At 148 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Warren Af Base, or near Cheyenne, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, Ranchettes, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, North Cheyenne, Warren Af Base, South Greeley and Fox Farm-College. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 8 and 21. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 357 and 370. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills
